author: Shane Magee
description: Moncton council has voted to sell downtown property for an undisclosed amount to a developer pitching a mixed-use building with 10 per cent of the residential units described as affordable housing.
title: Moncton selling downtown land for mixed-used 9-storey building
content: Moncton council voted Monday to sell downtown property for an undisclosed amount to a developer pitching a mixed-use building with 10 per cent of the residential units described as affordable housing… [+4160 chars]

author: Raechel Huizinga
description: If the only restaurant at the Greater Moncton Roméo LeBlanc International Airport hadn’t eventually opened, Mike Wazny and his girlfriend, who were en route to Winnipeg after a trip out east, would have been waiting at least nine hours without any food.
title: What makes an hours-long airport delay worse? The only restaurant is closed
content:
Mike Wazny was about to try ordering a pizza.

author: Shane Magee
description: A newly released report by New Brunswick Public Health says Organigram had no regular cleaning of cooling towers that were the source of a 2019 legionnaires' disease outbreak in Moncton.
title: Organigram didn't regularly clean cooling towers linked to 2019 legionnaires' outbreak
content:
A newly released report by New Brunswick Public Health says Organigram had no regular cleaning of cooling towers that were the source of a 2019 legionnaires' disease outbreak in Moncton.

author: Nishat Chowdhury
description: An 88-year-old Moncton man gave his handmade fishing rod from his teenage years to a young angler in the community after learning about the boy's love for fly fishing.
title: 88-year-old gives young angler the fly-fishing rod he made as a teen
content:
In support of his new hobby of fly fishing, 11-year-old Eli Billard from Moncton received a special fishing rod as a gift.
Made with four pieces of bamboo and about six feet long, the fishing rod wa… [+2242 chars]

author: Shane Magee
description: A provincial court judge has acquitted a Bathurst couple on charges they violated New Brunswick's pandemic restrictions during a protest against those measures in Moncton in 2021, saying protests were not prohibited.
title: Judge acquits Bathurst couple, says pandemic rules allowed protests
